intro: Niphobolus liebuschii, commonly known as the smooth thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with gray-green, spineless leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it produces small, oval-shaped achenes as fruits. Niphobolus liebuschii is often found in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
